text:
Raskolnikov's turmoil

Raskolnikov's face is twisted in distress.  
“I can’t have it! Enough, go away!”  
“Come, mamma, just a minute.”  
“Mayn’t I look at him after three years?”  

---

Pulcheria is teary, Dounia anxious.  
“Have you seen Luzhin?”  
“No, but he knows we’re here.”  
“Luzhin? I promised to throw him downstairs!”  

---

Pulcheria gasps, Dounia watches intently.  
“Rodya, what are you saying?”  
“I don’t want that marriage. Refuse him!”  
“Good Heavens!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov insists that his sister Dounia must refuse her marriage to Luzhin, expressing his distress and desire to end the connection.
